Column Comment.0: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.1: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.2: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.3: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.4: EQUIVALENCE IDENTIFIER: Unique indentifier for the equivalence between stratunits.
Column Comment.5: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.6: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.7: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area
Column Comment.8: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area
Column Comment.9: AREA TYPE: The type of area described, such as country, province, basin, project,business area etc.
Column Comment.10: AREA TYPE: The type of area described, such as country, province, basin, project,business area etc.
Column Comment.11: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date that the equivalence was first given.
Column Comment.12: STRATIGRAPHIC EQUIVALENCE DIRECTIONALITY: the direction in which theequivalence is valid, such as one way or two way. A lithstratigraphic bed may beequivalent to a formation, but the formation is not necessarily equivalent to the bed.
Column Comment.13: INTEPRETATION IDENTIFIER: added to enable a single strat unit to be identifiedmore than once as part of a stratigraphic column. Multiple occurances may occur formany reasons, including folding, faulting or a non-vertical interpretationof the stratcolumn.
Column Comment.14: STRATIGRAPHIC COLUMN ID: The ID assigned to the stratigraphic column.
Column Comment.15: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.16: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.17: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.18: REMARK: Narrative remarks about the stratigraphic equivalence.
Column Comment.19: SOURCE DOCUMENT: A list of documents that are used as the source for supplyingdata. Source documents may include government and regulatory forms, operatorreports or scout tickets, publications, news letters, books or jounals.
Column Comment.20: STRATIGRAPHIC COLUMN NAME: The name assigned to the stratigraphic column.
Column Comment.21: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.22: STRATIGRAPHIC EQUIVALENCE TYPE: the type of relationship between two units,two surfaces, or a unit and surface based on an interpretation that the two stratelements are the same age (equivalent stratigraphically and/or geochronologically),although they are seperated in space.
Column Comment.23: INTEPRETATION IDENTIFIER: added to enable a single strat unit to be identifiedmore than once as part of a stratigraphic column. Multiple occurances may occur formany reasons, including folding, faulting or a non-vertical interpretation of the stratcolumn.
Column Comment.24: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.25: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.26: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.27: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.28: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.29: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.30: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
